Alex is pretyt much a staple here and has covered a ton of things for us over the years. Puppy Play, Satisfyer Pro, Tokidoki, and the larger Buck Off.

If you don’t already follow him- I’d 100% reccomend you do. He puts out so much positivity into the world, and seeing his tweets pop up into my timeline are always a feel-good moment. Go tell him he’s awesome!

item.title: Magic Wand Plus & Mental Health
item.dc:creator: Erika Moen
item.description: Dang. What do I even say here? I’ll start with some links, howaboutthat. That very first Magic Wand was sent to me as an exchange with Searah from Early to Bed back about a decade or so ago, long, looooong before OJST was a twinkle in Matt’s and my eye. Fast-forward to 2013, when we […]
item.content:encoded:
Magic Wand Plus & Mental Health

by Erika Moen on 09/24/2019 at 12:02 am
  • Adventures »
  • Comic »
  • Review Comics »
  • Vibrators

Dang. What do I even say here?

I’ll start with some links, howaboutthat.

That very first Magic Wand was sent to me as an exchange with Searah from Early to Bed back about a decade or so ago, long, looooong before OJST was a twinkle in Matt’s and my eye. Fast-forward to 2013, when we released our very first review with that same Magic Wand. Then, several years later, Magic Wand released the Rechargeable, and would even later become Sponsors of OJST, three years running! It’s such a wonderful fit, getting to work with a company that, obviously, we’re both long-time fans of.

Ok, as for mental health stuff… I’ve been posting sporadically about my experiences on Instagram and Twitter when the mood strikes, and posting autobio comics about it on Patreon. I finished up the Intensive Outpatient Program in August and I’ll be starting a longer term Dialectical Behavior Therapy program through the hospital in October that’ll last about six months.

I know I’m supposed to say something, like, encouraging here. You know. “If you’re struggling… reach out! Get help!” or “It’ll get better!” or something. I’m not really feeling that right now, though? I mean, I’m not feeling the opposite of that either. I’m just… here. I’m here. I’m putting in the time and I’m doing the work and I’m tired. It’s hard. If you’re struggling with your mental health, jesus, you have all my empathy and I hope you can get the help that you need. Because getting that outside, structured help from people who really do understand what you’re dealing with really can make all the difference. For Americans, the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration has a hotline to call and for you international folks, google a combination of “mental health resources” and the name of your area. I dunno. There is no “cure” but there can be a reduction in suffering (Or, at least, that’s what I’m told). Take care of yourself. Do what you need to survive and find the assistance you need. Good luck.

Buy it from one of our Friends (With Benefits)

item.title: Sexual Dysfunction
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: Ok, so today’s comic is a smidge light – I know many of you will be shouting out ‘go deeper- explore the specific disorder I wanna learn about!’ We’ll for sure eventually get to the specific ones and explore them more thoroughly. We might have explored a few already in the health category. Thing is, […]
item.content:encoded:
Sexual Dysfunction

by Matthew Nolan on 09/17/2019 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Education Comics »
  • Health

Ok, so today’s comic is a smidge light – I know many of you will be shouting out ‘go deeper- explore the specific disorder I wanna learn about!’ We’ll for sure eventually get to the specific ones and explore them more thoroughly. We might have explored a few already in the health category. Thing is, for the next Drawn to Sex book, we needed a solid catch-all comic, something that introduces the subject and explains how anyone experiencing it is normal – it happens to us all. So that’s what we have today – a light comic that skims the surface!

If you’re feeling represented in this comic and see your own woes appearing, I’d really encourage you to go and have a frank conversation with your doctor. A good doc will listen and help and, honestly, they’ve heard it all before. You’ve nothing to be embarrassed or afraid of.

Next week, a review! First one in an age – we’re excited, it’s going to be half review and half autobio catchup.

└ Tags: arousal disorder, desire disorder, disorder, education, erectile dysfunction, orgasm disorder, pain disorder, Sexual Dysfunction, sexual response cycle

item.title: Sponsorship 2019-2020!
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: It’s wild, but another year has zipped on by. Oh Joy Sex Toy is now 6-7 years old! If it was a kid, apparently at this age it would be able to tell time, and that’s just wild. Welp, we’re starting autumn and, like the last few years, it’s time to unveil our new sponsors […]
item.content:encoded:
Sponsorship 2019-2020!

by Matthew Nolan on 09/04/2019 at 1:32 pm
Posted In: Blog

It’s wild, but another year has zipped on by. Oh Joy Sex Toy is now 6-7 years old! If it was a kid, apparently at this age it would be able to tell time, and that’s just wild. Welp, we’re starting autumn and, like the last few years, it’s time to unveil our new sponsors for the next twelve months!

Friends, family, and Dearest Perverts…

Oh Joy Sex Toy is once again advertisement-free from now until September 2020 thanks to the generosity and support of OMGYes.com and The Magic Wand!

We are delighted to have both of these amazing companies returning for a consecutive year. We love our Magic Wand and we adore the work OMGYes.com puts out there, it really is a dream team of sponsorship. We’re honored.

If you are thinking, “Wait, I don’t understand, ‘sponsorship’, what are they on about?” then friend, don’t worry, we’ve included all the details of what exactly this is over on our Sponsorship page. Check it out to see what we’ve been doing.

We hope you like the new OJST team-up! If you want to be a hero and are so inclined; give our friends-with-benefits a click and let them know they are good folk for helping us and our unique little website.

Here’s to another amazing year <3 ♥️♥️♥️ Matt

Duchess of Beefcake created an incredibly sexy story and we’re honoured to have it on the site! […]
item.content:encoded:
Superhero Spa by Duchess of Beefcake

by Matthew Nolan on 09/03/2019 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Guest Comics »
  • Guest Smutty Comics

That panel with the boner peeking out of the bathwater…
-sweats profusely-

I think it’s a real feat of comics when someone can hand in a such a short comic that delivers such a great amount of horny. Duchess of Beefcake created an incredibly sexy story and we’re honoured to have it on the site!

Visit their work and drop them mad coin if you have it to spare:

  • Twitter
  • Patreon

Today’s week one of two sexy story comics lined up. Erika’s been doing better and is finally out of the Intensive Mental Health Outpatient Program (updates on her Twitter, Instagram and Patreon). Which is great news! Next step is waiting in line for the hospital’s DBT program. We somehow didn’t manage to fall behind on our book work and are progressing pretty well!

I always feel like I ought to be apologizing for such a long stint of Erika and me not producing comics on here. But every time I get to post a new creator’s work or a topic that’s fresh with a new perspective, I feel like it makes the site more valuable and more powerful. It still blows my mind that through affiliate links, Patreon, book sales and sponsorship we can afford to run this free website for making and sharing positive sex comics in all their forms. Anyway, all this guest comic time is affording Erika and I book-working time, and this thing’s a beaut. We’re so proud of it so far, and we’re so close to being done with this 140 page beast!

└ Tags: beefy cake, duchess, duchess beefcake, guest, guest comic, porn comic, sexy, smutty, super hero, superhero

item.title: How Dildos Saved My Rear by Zach Clarkson
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: Another week, another guest comic! Our work schedule on the books and Erika’s time at the Intensive Outpatient Program for mental health means you’re in for a few more weeks of guest comics. It’s like getting a few more weeks of summer really, but way more fun =) Today, you’re seeing the comic work of […]
item.content:encoded:
How Dildos Saved My Rear by Zach Clarkson

by Matthew Nolan on 08/27/2019 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Guest Comics »
  • Guest Education »
  • Guest Story Comics »
  • How To

Another week, another guest comic!
Our work schedule on the books and Erika’s time at the Intensive Outpatient Program for mental health means you’re in for a few more weeks of guest comics. It’s like getting a few more weeks of summer really, but way more fun =) Today, you’re seeing the comic work of talented animation visual developer, Zach Clarkson! I ran into his beautiful work a few months ago and had to drop his an email, it’s absolutely gorgeous stuff.

His comic today is pretty light and easy – a little bit autobio, a little bit helpful tips. If you’re looking for a thicker slice of similar stuff, take a peek at some of our other butt sex comics:
– Butt Sex 101!
– Anus Anatomy
– Anal Sex Preperation
– Manual Sex (talks a bit about fingers in butts)
Then bonus round, comics on:
– Butt toys
– Lubes

Zach’s comic encourages you to start small when picking up a toy to start your anal adventures with. This is the one I was first to introduced to!

Links to Zach!

  • ZacharyClarkson.com
  • Twitter
  • Instagram

Want to stay looped in with all the craziness that’s happening in our lives? The best way is to follow Erika on Instagram or Twitter, and to sign up to Patreon – Erika’s been posting small lite comics and updates on our lives there. We can see the light at the end of the tunnel with regards to the crazy workload – We’re hoping in November-December we’ll be done with the books and able to take a break, before returning to the old schedule. As always we’re so, so, so thankful for your continued support and believing in what we do. I promise – you’ll all be so proud of these books when we get them done and in your hands <3

└ Tags: anal, butt, butt sex, education, first time, guest, guest comic, zach clarkson, zachary clarkson

While Bingo is […]
item.content:encoded:
Peyronie’s Disease by Bingo

by Matthew Nolan on 08/13/2019 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Education Comics »
  • Favorites »
  • Guest Comics »
  • Guest Education »
  • Health

Our last commissioned Bingo piece and this one’s (lifts pinkie away from the cup and sips with his eyes closed) educational!

Today, Bingo’s here to talk us through Peyronie’s Disease, a crummy penis affliction that super duper sucks.

As usual, if you think you’re suffering from this, take it into your doctor. While Bingo is amazing, neither they or us are actually doctors, so take all the info here with a grain of salt, and see real help, if your dicks getting its lean on.

Want to see more of Bingo’s work? Check out their comics on Body Image and their autobio on figuring out how to orgasm.

If you haven’t been on Patreon and aren’t up-to-date with our lives at the moment. Erika and I have been in stress-work-burn-out-crisis this past few weeks. Landing Erika in some intensive mental health hospital treatment. We… we’re just pushed a bit too hard this year with doing two books at once, and brains are breaking. Things are looking to get easier in December, and then we’ll be taking a longer holiday. This week though, Lucy Bellwood is stepping up to get us both some much-needed downtime and breathing room – so look forward to her comic next week <3 Treat yourselves well friends!

└ Tags: bend, bent, Bingo, cock, crooked, damage, education, furry, guest comic, lean, penile, penis, peyronie, Peyronie's disease

item.title: Panty Proposition by SofiaGray.com & Gabriele Falzone
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: We’re not strangers to weird and wacky emails, so when Erika first got an email from SofiaGray.com about working together, she just assumed they wanted a pair of her used undies. Imagine our surprise when it turned out they had a fully finished comic to give us! This is totally new – we usually commission […]
item.content:encoded:
Panty Proposition by SofiaGray.com & Gabriele Falzone

by Matthew Nolan on 08/06/2019 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Favorites »
  • Guest Comics »
  • Guest Smutty Comics »
  • Guest Story Comics »
  • Porn & Websites

We’re not strangers to weird and wacky emails, so when Erika first got an email from SofiaGray.com about working together, she just assumed they wanted a pair of her used undies.

Imagine our surprise when it turned out they had a fully finished comic to give us! This is totally new – we usually commission individual comic artists and work with them at every stage to make us comics and reviews. We’ve never had a company just present us with a finished comic, out of the blue. A comic on a subject we hadn’t considered yet, in a funny set up, and by an amazing Italian artist I hadn’t known previously – it’s a dream come true scenario!

Ok, so. Some caveats to today’s comic!
– This comic isn’t an OJST review, we didn’t make or work on it.
– We personally haven’t tested or tried the services at SofiaGray.com, so we can’t attest to it. But our contact with the team there has been just lovely and the site looks awesome. We’re happy to generally endorse the practice of selling used undies and the people who take part in it – it’s harmless good fun.
– This comic isn’t a how-to-sell-panties comic. It’s just a slice of sexy comedy. You can and should visit SofiaGray.com for the how-to if this catches your interest.
– Today’s comic is fiction, buying panties doesn’t mean you’ll be sparking romantic relationships in real life through the used-panties trade. Treat others respectfully and practice good sexting etiquette, ask if the person on the other end of the screen wants to talk saucy before you dive.

That all being said, here are some links to both SofiaGray.com AND the artist Gabriele Falzone (who did an insanely good job):

  • SofiaGray.com
  • Gabriele Falzone

Today’s comic is well-timed and nets us another work week on the Random House Book, Let’s Talk About It. Having that extra time means less stress, which is a godsend, right now. If you’re interested, Erika’s been posting a bit about her current mental health trubs on Patreon with some old school journal comics. It’s worth a read if you’re interested in how we’re doing (the skinny is: rough, surviving, one-day-at-a-time).

As always thank you for reading our comics and supporting what we do <3


EDIT August 19
We edited the ending to today’s comic to better line up with the overall tone of our site. The comic is still fun and just gorgeously drawn and we’ll aim to curate a bit better in the future.
